cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 495 miles east of the Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing westward with gradual turn to the west-northwest, expected to cross the northern Leeward Islands Friday night, then track toward the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico late Saturday into Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern Puerto Rico / near San Juan

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for Guadeloupe, St. Barthelemy, and St. Martin
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect for Antigua, Barbuda, St. Kitts, Nevis, Montserrat, Anguilla, Saba, St. Eustatius, and St. Maarten
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and eastern Hispaniola
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (30–45 mph) possible late Saturday into Sunday with 22% onset probability peaking around 72 h
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible along north- and east-facing shores, generally below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches widespread with isolated 10 inches over eastern Puerto Rico, risk of flash floods and mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; elevated seas will disrupt vessel movements and berthing operations
